{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3636816,"name":"4391 Programming Mentor","username":"aveeser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-27T12:48:36.199Z","cooked":"

Our team did full field pose estimation with vision updates very successfully in 2025 using 1 Limelight 3G camera. We had a variety of factors we used to determine how much we “trusted” the camera data and we adjusted the standard deviation accordingly when adding the vision updated to our pose estimator. We notice a lot of teams are using more than one camera for this and we may add one for next year. Question is: With the 2nd, or even 3rd, camera, are you just adding it’s data to the pose estimator with another “add vision update” call? Or are you staying with just one single “add vision update” command and changing which camera data is being used based on which one has been determined to have the better data? Or some other method? We have this little feeling that having multiple updates happening to our pose estimator may be rough on our processor and wanted to get some ideas on how other are doing this. Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-05-27T12:48:36.199Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":272,"readers_count":271,"score":139.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502437,"topic_slug":"pose-updates-from-multiple-cameras-how","display_username":"4391 Programming Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56643,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pose-updates-from-multiple-cameras-how/502437/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3636817,"name":"Rahul Yarlagadda","username":"Knufire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/knufire/{size}/67820_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-27T12:51:30.928Z","cooked":"
aveeser:

Question is: With the 2nd, or even 3rd, camera, are you just adding it’s data to the pose estimator with another “add vision update” call?

This is usually the case. Extra cameras just mean you spend more time with an Apriltag in view.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-05-27T12:51:30.928Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":263,"readers_count":262,"score":97.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":502437,"topic_slug":"pose-updates-from-multiple-cameras-how","display_username":"Rahul Yarlagadda","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7457 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pose-updates-from-multiple-cameras-how/502437/2","custom_user_title":"7457 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3636822,"name":"Owen Busler","username":"Owen_Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-27T13:01:31.616Z","cooked":"
aveeser:

just adding it’s data to the pose estimator with another “add vision update” call? Or are you staying with just one single “add vision update” command and changing which camera data is being used based on which one has been determined to have the better data? Or some other method?

We used a combination of both. Looking at all the camera results, we did filtering on pose ambiguity, distance to tag, estimated pose vs current expected pose to determine if we should add it to our pose estimator.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-05-27T13:01:31.616Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":247,"readers_count":246,"score":64.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502437,"topic_slug":"pose-updates-from-multiple-cameras-how","display_username":"Owen Busler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23320,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pose-updates-from-multiple-cameras-how/502437/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3636871,"name":"Ryan Shavell","username":"Ryan_S","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_s/{size}/250016_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-27T14:32:48.337Z","cooked":"

One or both approaches can be applicable depending on your camera setup. For us this year, we’d choose between our two cameras since they were both facing the same direction - when we got readings from our close-range “scoring” camera we’d ignore data from our other longer range camera.

More commonly though, teams will filter the data from all cameras and then apply updates from all of them, with the std devs varying based on which camera’s data is better or which critical tags are on screen.

Both suggestions can be used for it. But passing the value on the same vision update would be more efficient for not make the code mess.

this season we ran five 50 fps cameras, so 250 fps if all cameras have a tag in view. we just throw all the tag pose sightings into the pose update, which is similar to the WPI one, with some weighting for distance. I was worried about the pose update load, particularly the repeated odometry replays, and the GC pressure resulting from many 3d transformations (thus allocations) in Java, so I did some profiling. it turned out not to be much of a problem at all, even at full load, which was a bit of a surprise. so I’d suggest not worrying about it.
